item.title: Olympic Gas
item.description: This is a gas pump down the street from our home. The prices, according to national averages, are average. The layout – not so much. What reason could there possibly be to put the most common choice in the center without any additional visual cues that it is what the customer is probably looking for? The only reasonable explanation is whoever designed this hopes customers won’t notice until it’s too late, choose a different grade, and then not be bothered to cancel the transaction and start over.
